messages.title: A vote for the Green Party means a vote for--
messages.content: Joined up policies to cope with climate change; a better future for the vast majority of our children and a reduction in inequality; A NEW form of politics where voters and small businesses are heard instead of herded by the big 2 party machines and the Eton boys at Westminster.

messages.title: And a vote against:-
messages.content: The ever increasing gap between the super rich and us, the majority; Bankers’ gambling with our money while earning huge bonuses and never being prosecuted for their mistakes; An intolerant society where EU immigrants are blamed for government failures; The inexoriant onsl and gauid looby’s influence on our future, our democracy and international good will.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Joined up policies to cope with climate change; protecting our planet from climate change.
Transitioning energy subsidies from fossil fuels to renewables, creating British businesses and jobs while protecting our planet from climate change.
Restoring public services (e.g. schools, prison services, police) into accountable public hands with funding to ensure they are run in the interests of those who use them.
Sustainable long-term planning of transport; renationalising the railways and using them to ease freight congestion and pollution at Dover.
The NHS free of privatisation at any level and funded adequately through taxation.
Protecting East Kent’s water supplies and preventing the extraction of coal bed methane and shale gas by hydraulic fracking.
High levels of animal welfare and a stop to live exports.
A much reformed European Union that stands up to the big bullying multinational corporations and more acceptance by the UK of the EU funding we are offered.
Having better access to secure jobs that pay at least the Living Wage.
A people’s constitutional convention to make our democracy more inclusive.
St James and Albert Road developments to be sustainably built for local economy.
Greater awareness that roughly as many Brits (2 million) work in other EU countries as the number of EU people coming here.

issues.brexitEurope: A much reformed European Union that stands up to the big bullying multinational corporations and more acceptance by the UK of the EU funding we are offered.
issues.economy: Transitioning energy subsidies from fossil fuels to renewables, creating British businesses and jobs while protecting our planet from climate change.
issues.education: Restoring public services (e.g. schools, prison services, police) into accountable public hands with funding to ensure they are run in the interests of those who use them.
issues.environment: Joined up policies to cope with climate change; protecting our planet from climate change.
issues.health: The NHS free of privatisation at any level and funded adequately through taxation.

leaflet.personalStatement: I stood in local and council elections in Kent previously, getting 12% of the vote in 2009 county elections. I’m the Kent Green Party’s International Officer. I live in Whitstable but worked at the docks in Dover and have been an active campaigner on energy, transport, and animal welfare issues. I went to Oxford University despite leaving school at 16 and work freelance as a technical author.

politicalExperience.achievements: Stood in local and council elections, getting 12% of the vote in 2009 county elections. Worked at docks in Dover and have been active campaigner on energy, transport, and animal welfare issues.

contactInformation.address: Promoted by G Meaden. 2 Bridge Hill Cottage, Honeywood Road, Dover, Kent. CT160RH. Printed by Adams Printers, Dover CT16 1EW

images.caption: Jolyon Trimingham, our Green Party parliamentary candidate in Dover and Deal selected 2014.
